title: Ticket #3473: Gridmanager ignores Arguments2 for Cream jobs
description:
When the gridmanager constructs a CREAM job request, it only looks at the Arguments1 attribute in the job ad, ignoring Arguments2. This means that if the user quotes the job's arguments in the submit file, then the job is submitted to CREAM without any arguments.

Unfortunately, the CREAM Job Description Language (JDL) document (https://edms.cern.ch/file/592336/1/CREAM-JDL.pdf) is vague on how to properly encode the job's arguments. The arguments are represented by a single string, and it sounds like that the string will be processed verbatim by the shell on the execute machine.
